heroDescription: Newport Beach, California, is a coastal city known for its affluent lifestyle and vibrant economy.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 87,273, Newport Beach boasts a diverse economy driven by tourism, real estate, and finance. The city is a hub for high-net-worth individuals and luxury services.
uniqueNeeds: High demand for luxury real estate and services, coupled with a need for financial planning among affluent residents.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Newport Beach's real estate market faces bubble risks amid high valuations. Diversify investments to mitigate tech and finance sector risks, and prepare for potential flooding.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Newport Beach's economy has shown resilience with a growth rate of 3.5% in the past year, driven by tourism and luxury retail.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), Newport Beach has a median income of $115,000, with a significant portion of households earning over $200,000.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Newport Beach increasingly specialize in wealth management and estate planning for high-net-worth clients.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Newport Beach's cost of living is 50% higher than the national average, driven by housing and luxury services.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the median home price in Newport Beach is approximately $2.5 million, reflecting a competitive and high-demand market.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Newport Beach's business climate is favorable, with a focus on innovation and high-end services attracting new ventures.
